intro: Athamanta turbith subsp. haynaldii, commonly known as the Haynald's alpine bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in mountainous environments. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to cold, harsh climates. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
